key_channel_insights.line_content: 93 % of OTA fares matched the airline site last week, but mark-ups doubled WoW to 3.2 % of itineraries at an 11 % premium.
92.7 % of MSE fares were cheaper than direct (-3-4 % on average); parity remains limited at 6.4 % despite a slight weekly uptick.
GDS priced 98.6 % of itineraries above the website with a steep 37 % average premium, reinforcing its high-fare positioning.

conclusion.line_content: This report provides a high-level summary of the price discrepancies observed across different channels.  It is important to note that the data contains many nuances depending on various factors such as market conditions, booking windows, and the competitive landscape. Understanding these subtleties can be critical in optimizing pricing strategies and ensuring competitive positioning.

As part of our 'PriceEye' solution, we are developing an intuitive dashboard designed to help your airline's analysts drill down into this data. This tool will allow you to uncover and focus on critical actionable insights, enabling your team to make data-driven decisions with confidence.

We are here to support you in leveraging these insights to enhance your revenue management and distribution strategies. Please don't hesitate to connect with our team for more information about how PriceEye can assist you in achieving your business objectives.

ota_highlights.line_content: 93 % of OTA itineraries priced exactly the same as direct, confirming robust short-haul control.
Mark-up cases rose 61 % WoW to 3.2 % of traffic, commanding an 11 % premium.
Only 1.5 % of fares were cheaper on OTAs; average saving a modest 9 %.

ota_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: Just 2.0 % of OD pairs were missing on OTAs, albeit 60 % higher WoW.
Parity slipped 1.8 ppt WoW but, at 93 %, stays 12 ppt stronger than a month ago.
OTA-higher share reached 3.2 % (+61 % WoW) with an 11 % premium.
OTA-lower share is 1.5 %, frequency up 59 % WoW but below last month.

ota_summary_by_region.line_content: Short-haul parity identical to total (93 %); mark-ups at 3.2 %, discounts 1.5 %.

ota_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: Parity 93.9 %; mark-ups 3.4 % with a higher 13 % premium.

ota_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: Parity dips to 91 %; mark-up frequency doubles WoW to 4.0 % at an 11 % premium.
98 % parity; mark-ups only 0.9 % but at the highest 13 % premium when they occur.

mse_highlights.line_content: 92.7 % of MSE fares priced below direct; premiums virtually absent.
Parity improved 1.5 ppt WoW to 6.4 %, indicating early signs of stabilization.
For >21-day bookings, 95.8 % of fares were lower on MSE, flagging advance-purchase revenue leakage.

mse_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: Only 0.6 % of ODs missing on MSE; stable WoW.
6.4 % fares matched direct (+1.5 ppt WoW); price gap negligible.
MSE undercut direct on 92.7 % of itineraries; avg discount 3-4 %.
Premium cases just 0.3 %, carrying a 3 % uplift.

mse_summary_by_region.line_content: 92.7 % of short-haul fares lower on MSE, mirroring overall trend.

mse_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: MSE lower share 93.9 %; only market with any premiums (0.6 %).
Lower share 91.6 %; no premium events recorded.

mse_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: Undercutting peaks at 95.8 % with zero premium cases.

gds_highlights.line_content: 98.6 % of GDS fares priced above direct, averaging +37 %.
Parity or lower fares surfaced on 0.6 % of itineraries, up from zero the prior week.
Website offers not in GDS fell to 0.9 % (-56 % WoW).

gds_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: GDS gaps reduced to 0.9 % (-56 % WoW; ‑85 % MoM).
Exact-match fares at 0.29 %, newly observed last week.
Premium cases steady at 98.55 % with a 37 % uplift.

gds_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: 98.2 % higher with 34 % premium; 1.8 % offers missing; no parity or undercut.
98.9 % higher with 40 % premium; all parity (0.56 %) and undercuts occur here.

gds_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: 100 % higher-priced; avg premium 46 %, 2 ppt below monthly benchmark.
